  Elizabeth sister , who joined Elizabeth with a cheerful look , which showed behaviour to Elizabeth sister , who joined Elizabeth with a cheerful look , which showed was such , during dinner time , as showed an admiration of Elizabeth sister , who joined Elizabeth with a cheerful look , which showed , which , though more guarded than formerly , persuaded Elizabeth , that if left wholly to Elizabeth sister , who joined Elizabeth with a cheerful look , which showed , Elizabeth sister , who joined Elizabeth with a cheerful look , which showed happiness , and Elizabeth sister , who joined Elizabeth with a cheerful look , which showed own , would be speedily secured . Though Elizabeth dared not depend upon the consequence , Elizabeth yet received pleasure from observing Elizabeth sister , who joined Elizabeth with a cheerful look , which showed behaviour . Elizabeth sister , who joined Elizabeth with a cheerful look , which showed behaviour gave Elizabeth all the animation that Elizabeth spirits could boast ; for Elizabeth was in no cheerful humour . Fitzwilliam ’s was almost as far from Elizabeth as the table could divide them . Fitzwilliam ’s was on one side of Elizabeth mother . Elizabeth knew how little such a situation would give pleasure to either , or make either appear to advantage . Elizabeth was not near enough to hear any of their discourse , but Elizabeth could see how seldom their spoke to each other , and how formal and cold was their manner whenever their did . Elizabeth mother ’s ungraciousness , made the sense of what their owed Fitzwilliam ’s more painful to Elizabeth ’s mind ; and Elizabeth would , at times , have given anything to be privileged to tell Fitzwilliam ’s that Fitzwilliam ’s kindness was neither unknown nor unfelt by the whole of the family . 
 
  Elizabeth was in hopes that the evening would afford some opportunity of bringing their together ; that the whole of the visit would not pass away without enabling their to enter into something more of conversation than the mere ceremonious salutation attending Fitzwilliam ’s entrance . Anxious and uneasy , the period which passed in the dining - room , before the gentlemen came , was wearisome and dull to a degree that almost made Elizabeth uncivil . Elizabeth looked forward to the gentlemen entrance as the point on which all Elizabeth chance of pleasure for the evening must depend . 
 
  “ If Fitzwilliam ’s does not come to Elizabeth , then , ” said Elizabeth , “ Elizabeth shall give Fitzwilliam ’s up for ever . ” the gentlemen The gentlemen came ; and Elizabeth thought Fitzwilliam ’s looked as if Fitzwilliam ’s would have answered Elizabeth hopes ; but , alas ! the ladies had crowded round the table , where Miss Bennet was making tea , and Elizabeth pouring out the coffee , in so close a confederacy that there was not a single vacancy near Elizabeth which would admit of a chair . And on the gentlemen ’s approaching , one of the ladies moved closer to Elizabeth than ever , and said , in a whisper : 
 
  “ the gentlemen sha n’t come and part us , one of the ladies am determined . us want none of the gentlemen ; do us ? ” 
 
  Fitzwilliam ’s had walked away to another part of the dining - room . Elizabeth followed Fitzwilliam ’s with Elizabeth eyes , envied everyone to whom Fitzwilliam ’s spoke , had scarcely patience enough to help anybody to coffee ; and then was enraged against Elizabeth for being so silly ! 
 
  “ Fitzwilliam ’s How could Elizabeth ever be foolish enough to expect a renewal of Fitzwilliam ’s love ? Is there one among the sex , who would not protest against such a weakness as a second proposal to the same woman ? There is no indignity so abhorrent to their feelings ! ” 
 
  Elizabeth was a little revived , however , by Fitzwilliam ’s bringing back Fitzwilliam ’s coffee cup Fitzwilliam ’s ; and Elizabeth seized the opportunity of saying : 
 
  “ Is Fitzwilliam ’s sister at Pemberley still ? ” 
 
  “ Yes , Fitzwilliam ’s sister will remain there till Christmas . ” 
 
  “ And quite alone ? Have all Fitzwilliam ’s sister friends left Fitzwilliam ’s sister ? ” 
 
  “ Mrs. Annesley is with Fitzwilliam ’s sister . The others have been gone on to Scarborough , these three weeks . ” 
 
  Elizabeth could think of nothing more to say ; but if Fitzwilliam ’s wished to converse with Elizabeth , Fitzwilliam ’s might have better success . Fitzwilliam ’s stood by Elizabeth , however , for some minutes , in silence ; and , at last , on one of the ladies whispering to Elizabeth again , Fitzwilliam ’s walked away . 
 
  When the tea - things were removed , and the card - tables placed , the ladies all rose , and Elizabeth was then hoping to be soon joined by Fitzwilliam ’s , when all Elizabeth views were overthrown by seeing Fitzwilliam ’s fall a victim to Elizabeth mother ’s rapacity for whist players , and in a few moments after seated with the rest of the party . Elizabeth now lost every expectation of pleasure . their were confined for the evening at different tables , and Elizabeth had nothing to hope , but that Fitzwilliam ’s eyes were so often turned towards Elizabeth side of the room , as to make Fitzwilliam ’s play as unsuccessfully as Elizabeth . 
 
  Mother had designed to keep the two Netherfield gentlemen to supper ; but the two Netherfield gentlemen carriage was unluckily ordered before any of the others , and Mother had no opportunity of detaining the two Netherfield gentlemen . 
 
  “ Well the ladies , ” said Mother , as soon as the ladies were left to the ladies , “ What say Elizabeth sister , who joined Elizabeth with a cheerful look , which showed to the day ? Elizabeth sister , who joined Elizabeth with a cheerful look , which showed think every thing has passed off uncommonly well , Elizabeth sister , who joined Elizabeth with a cheerful look , which showed assure the ladies . The dinner was as well dressed as any Elizabeth sister , who joined Elizabeth with a cheerful look , which showed ever saw . The venison was roasted to a turn — and everybody said everybody never saw so fat a haunch . The soup was fifty times better than what we had at the Lucases ’ last week ; and Fitzwilliam ’s Fitzwilliam ’s acknowledged , that the partridges were remarkably well done ; and Elizabeth sister , who joined Elizabeth with a cheerful look , which showed suppose Fitzwilliam ’s has two or three French cooks at least . And , Elizabeth sister , who joined Elizabeth with a cheerful look , which showed , Mother never saw Elizabeth sister , who joined Elizabeth with a cheerful look , which showed look in greater beauty . Mrs. Annesley said so too , for Mother asked Mrs. Annesley whether Elizabeth sister , who joined Elizabeth with a cheerful look , which showed did not . And what do Elizabeth sister , who joined Elizabeth with a cheerful look , which showed think Mrs. Annesley said besides ? ‘ Ah ! Mother , we shall have Elizabeth sister , who joined Elizabeth with a cheerful look , which showed at Netherfield at last . ’ Mrs. Annesley did indeed . Elizabeth sister , who joined Elizabeth with a cheerful look , which showed do think Mrs. Annesley is as good a creature as ever lived — and Mrs. Annesley nieces are very pretty behaved girls , and not at all handsome : Elizabeth sister , who joined Elizabeth with a cheerful look , which showed like Mrs. Annesley nieces prodigiously . ” Mother Mother , in short , was in very great spirits ; Mother had seen enough of Charles ’s behaviour to Elizabeth sister , who joined Elizabeth with a cheerful look , which showed , to be convinced that Mother would get Charles at last ; and Mother expectations of advantage to Mother family , when in a happy humour , were so far beyond reason , that Mother was quite disappointed at not seeing Charles there again the next day , to make Charles proposals . 
 
  “ the day has been a very agreeable day , ” said Miss Bennet to Elizabeth . “ The party seemed so well selected , so suitable one with the other . Miss Bennet hope we may often meet again . ” 
 
  Elizabeth smiled . 
 
  “ Elizabeth , Elizabeth must not do so . Elizabeth must not suspect Elizabeth . It mortifies Elizabeth . Elizabeth assure Elizabeth that Elizabeth have now learnt to enjoy Fitzwilliam ’s conversation as an agreeable and sensible young man , without having a wish beyond it . Elizabeth am perfectly satisfied , from what Fitzwilliam ’s manners now are , that Fitzwilliam ’s never had any design of engaging Elizabeth affection . It is only that Fitzwilliam ’s is blessed with greater sweetness of address , and a stronger desire of generally pleasing , than any other man . ” 
 
  “ Elizabeth are very cruel , ” said Elizabeth sister , “ Elizabeth will not let Elizabeth sister , who joined Elizabeth with a cheerful look , which showed smile , and are provoking Elizabeth sister , who joined Elizabeth with a cheerful look , which showed to smile every moment . ” 
 
  “ How hard it is in some cases to be believed ! ” 
 
  “ And how impossible in others ! ” 
 
  “ But why should Elizabeth wish to persuade Elizabeth that Elizabeth feel more than Elizabeth acknowledge ? ” 
 
  “ That is a question which Elizabeth hardly know how to answer . We all love to instruct , though We all can teach only what is not worth knowing . Forgive Elizabeth ; and if Elizabeth persist in indifference , do not make Elizabeth Elizabeth confidante . ” 
 Chapter 
 
  A few days after this visit , Charles called again , and alone . Charles friend had left Charles that morning for London , but was to return home in ten days time . Charles sat with the ladies above an hour , and was in remarkably good spirits . Mother invited Charles to dine with the ladies ; but , with many expressions of concern , Charles confessed Charles engaged elsewhere . 
 
  “ Next time Charles call , ” said Mother , “ Mother hope we shall be more lucky . ” 
 
  Charles should be particularly happy at any time , etc . etc . ; and if Mother would give Charles leave , would take an early opportunity of waiting on the ladies . 
 
  “ Can Charles come to - morrow ? ” 
 
  Yes , Charles had no engagement at all for to - morrow ; and Mother invitation was accepted with alacrity . 
 
  Charles came , and in such very good time that the ladies were none of the ladies dressed . In ran Mother to Mother daughter ’s room , in Mother dressing gown , and with Mother hair half finished , crying out : 
 
  “ Mother daughter ’s , make haste and hurry down . Charles is come — Charles is come . Charles is , indeed . Make haste , make haste . Here , Sarah , come to Miss Bennet this moment , and help Bennet on with Bennet gown . Never mind Miss Elizabeth ’s hair . ” 
 
  “ We will be down as soon as we can , ” said Mother daughter ’s ; “ but Mother daughter ’s dare say Kitty is forwarder than either of We , for Kitty went up stairs half an hour ago . ” 
 
  “ Oh ! hang Kitty ! what has Kitty to do with it ? Come be quick , be quick ! Where is Mother daughter ’s sash , Mother dear ? ” 
 
  But when Mother daughter ’s mother was gone , Mother daughter ’s would not be prevailed on to go down without one of Mother daughter ’s sisters . 
 
  The same anxiety to get the ladies by the ladies was visible again in the evening . After tea , Father retired to the library , as was Father custom , and Mary went up stairs to Mary instrument . Two obstacles of the ladies being thus removed , Mother sat looking and winking at Elizabeth ’s and Catherine for a considerable time , without making any impression on Elizabeth ’s and Catherine . Elizabeth ’s would not observe Mother ; and when at last Kitty did , Kitty very innocently said , “ What is the matter Mother ? What do Mother keep winking at Kitty for ? What am Kitty to do ? ” 
 
  “ Nothing Kitty , nothing . Mother did not wink at Kitty . ” Mother then sat still five minutes longer ; but unable to waste such a precious occasion , Mother suddenly got up , and saying to Kitty , “ Come here , Kitty , Mother want to speak to Kitty , ” took Kitty out of the room . Mother daughter ’s instantly gave a look at Elizabeth ’s which spoke Mother daughter ’s distress at such premeditation , and Mother daughter ’s entreaty that Elizabeth ’s would not give in to such premeditation . In a few minutes , Mother half - opened the door and called out : 
 
  “ Elizabeth ’s Mother dear , Mother want to speak with Elizabeth ’s . ” 
 
  Elizabeth ’s was forced to go . 
 
  “ We may as well leave Elizabeth ’s and Catherine by Elizabeth ’s and Catherine Elizabeth ’s know ; ” said Elizabeth ’s mother , as soon as Elizabeth ’s was in the hall . “ Kitty and Mother are going up stairs to sit in Mother dressing - room . ” 
 
  Elizabeth ’s made no attempt to reason with Elizabeth ’s mother , but remained quietly in the hall , till Elizabeth ’s and Kitty were out of sight , then returned into the drawing - room . 
 
  Mother ’s schemes for this day were ineffectual . Charles was every thing that was charming , except the professed lover of Mother daughter ’s . Charles ease and cheerfulness rendered Charles a most agreeable addition to their evening party ; and Charles bore with the ill - judged officiousness of the mother , and heard all Mother silly remarks with a forbearance and command of countenance particularly grateful to Mother daughter ’s . 
 
  Charles scarcely needed an invitation to stay supper ; and before Charles went away , an engagement was formed , chiefly through Charles own and Mother ’s means , for Charles coming next morning to shoot with Mother husband . 
 
  After this day , Mother daughter ’s said no more of Mother daughter ’s indifference . Not a word passed between the ladies concerning Charles ; but Elizabeth ’s went to bed in the happy belief that all must speedily be concluded , unless Fitzwilliam returned within the stated time . Seriously , however , Elizabeth ’s felt tolerably persuaded that all this must have taken place with Charles concurrence . 
 
  Charles was punctual to Charles appointment ; and Charles and Father spent the morning together , as had been agreed on . Charles was much more agreeable than Charles companion expected . There was nothing of presumption or folly in Charles that could provoke Charles ridicule , or disgust Charles into silence ; and Charles was more communicative , and less eccentric , than the other had ever seen Charles . Charles of course returned with Charles to dinner ; and in the evening Mother ’s invention was again at work to get every body away from Charles and Mother daughter ’s . Elizabeth ’s , went into the breakfast room for that purpose soon after tea ; for as the others were all going to sit down to cards , Elizabeth ’s could not be wanted to counteract Elizabeth ’s mother ’s schemes . 
 
  But on returning to the drawing - room , when Elizabeth ’s letter was finished , Elizabeth ’s saw , to Elizabeth ’s infinite surprise , there was reason to fear that Elizabeth ’s mother had been too ingenious for Elizabeth ’s . On opening the door , Elizabeth ’s perceived Mother daughter ’s and Charles standing together over the hearth , as if engaged in earnest conversation ; and had this led to no suspicion , the faces of Mother daughter ’s and Charles , as Mother daughter ’s and Charles hastily turned round and moved away from each other , would have told it all . Mother daughter ’s and Charles situation was awkward enough ; but Elizabeth ’s Elizabeth ’s thought was still worse . Not a syllable was uttered by either ; and Elizabeth ’s was on the point of going away again , when Charles , who as well as the other had sat down , suddenly rose , and whispering a few words to Mother daughter ’s , ran out of the room . 
 
  Mother daughter ’s could have no reserves from Elizabeth ’s ; and instantly embracing Elizabeth ’s , acknowledged , with the liveliest emotion , that Elizabeth ’s was the happiest creature in the world . 
 
  “ ’ Tis too much ! ” Mother daughter ’s added , “ by far too much . Mother daughter ’s do not deserve it . Oh ! why is not everybody as happy ? ” 
 
  Elizabeth ’s congratulations were given with a sincerity , a warmth , a delight , which words could but poorly express . Every sentence of kindness was a fresh source of happiness to Mother daughter ’s . But Mother daughter ’s would not allow Mother daughter ’s to stay with Mother daughter ’s sister , or say half that remained to be said for the present . 
 
  “ Mother daughter ’s must go instantly to Mother daughter ’s mother ; ” Mother daughter ’s cried . “ Mother daughter ’s would not on any account trifle with Mother affectionate solicitude ; or allow Mother to hear it from anyone but Mother daughter ’s . He is gone to Mother daughter ’s father already . Oh ! Elizabeth ’s , to know that what Mother daughter ’s have to relate will give such pleasure to all Mother daughter ’s dear family ! how shall Mother daughter ’s bear so much happiness ! ” 
 
  Mother daughter ’s then hastened away to Mother daughter ’s mother , who had purposely broken up the card party , and was sitting up stairs with Kitty . 
 
  Elizabeth ’s Elizabeth ’s , now smiled at the rapidity and ease with which an affair was finally settled , that had given them so many previous months of suspense and vexation . 
 
  “ And this , ” said Elizabeth ’s , “ is the end of all He friend ’s anxious circumspection ! of all He sister ’s falsehood and contrivance ! the happiest , wisest , most reasonable end ! ” 
 
  In a few minutes Elizabeth ’s was joined by Charles , whose conference with Elizabeth ’s father had been short and to the purpose . 
 
  “ Where is Elizabeth ’s sister ? ” said Charles hastily , as Charles opened the door . 
 
  “ With Charles mother up stairs . He sister ’s will be down in a moment , Charles dare say . ” 
 
  Charles then shut the door , and , coming up to Elizabeth ’s , claimed the good wishes and affection of a sister . Elizabeth ’s honestly and heartily expressed Elizabeth ’s delight in the prospect of their relationship . their shook hands with great cordiality ; and then , till He sister ’s came down , Elizabeth ’s had to listen to all Charles had to say of Charles own happiness , and of Mother daughter ’s perfections ; and in spite of Charles being a lover , Elizabeth ’s really believed all Charles expectations of felicity to be rationally founded , because all Charles expectations of felicity had for basis the excellent understanding , and super - excellent disposition of Mother daughter ’s , and a general similarity of feeling and taste between Mother daughter ’s and Charles . 
 
  It was an evening of no common delight to the ladies ; the satisfaction of Miss Bennet ’s mind gave a glow of such sweet animation to Bennet face , as made Bennet look handsomer than ever . Kitty simpered and smiled , and hoped Kitty turn was coming soon . Mother could not give Mother consent or speak Mother approbation in terms warm enough to satisfy Mother feelings , though Mother talked to Charles of nothing else for half an hour ; and when Father joined the ladies at supper , Father voice and manner plainly showed how really happy Father was . 
 
  Not a word , however , passed Father lips in allusion to it , till the ladies visitor took the ladies visitor leave for the night ; but as soon as the ladies visitor was gone , Father turned to Mother daughter ’s , and said : 
 
  “ Mother daughter ’s , Father congratulate Mother daughter ’s . Mother daughter ’s will be a very happy woman . ” 
 
  Mother daughter ’s went to Father instantly , kissed Father , and thanked Father for Father goodness . 
 
  “ Mother daughter ’s are a good girl ; ” Father replied , “ and Father have great pleasure in thinking Mother daughter ’s will be so happily settled . Father have not a doubt of Mother daughter ’s doing very well together . Mother daughter ’s tempers are by no means unlike . Mother daughter ’s are each of Mother daughter ’s so complying , that nothing will ever be resolved on ; so easy , that every servant will cheat Mother daughter ’s ; and so generous , that Mother daughter ’s will always exceed Mother daughter ’s income . ” 
 
  “ Father hope not so . Imprudence or thoughtlessness in money matters would be unpardonable in Father . ” 
 
  “ Exceed their income ! Mother dear Father , ” cried Father wife , “ what are Father talking of ? Why , Father has four or five thousand a year , and very likely more . ” Then addressing Mother daughter ’s , “ Oh ! Elizabeth ’s , Father wife am so happy ! Father wife am sure Father wife sha n’t get a wink of sleep all night . Father wife knew how it would be . Father wife always said it must be so , at last . Father wife was sure Mother daughter ’s could not be so beautiful for nothing ! Father wife remember , as soon as ever Father wife saw Charles , when Charles first came into Hertfordshire last year , Father wife thought how likely it was that Mother daughter ’s should come together . Oh ! Charles is the handsomest young man that ever was seen ! ” 
 
  George , Lydia , were all forgotten . Mother daughter ’s was beyond competition Father wife favourite child . At that moment , Mother daughter ’s cared for no other . Mother daughter ’s younger sisters soon began to make interest with Mother daughter ’s for objects of happiness which Mother daughter ’s might in future be able to dispense . 
 
  Mary petitioned for the use of the library at Netherfield ; and Kitty begged very hard for a few balls there every winter . 
 
  Charles , from this time , was of course a daily visitor at Longbourn ; coming frequently before breakfast , and always remaining till after supper ; unless when some barbarous neighbour , who could not be enough detested , had given Charles an invitation to dinner which Charles thought Charles obliged to accept . 
 
  Elizabeth ’s had now but little time for conversation with Elizabeth ’s sister ; for while Charles was present , Mother daughter ’s had no attention to bestow on anyone else ; but Mother daughter ’s found Mother daughter ’s considerably useful to Charles and Father in those hours of separation that must sometimes occur . In the absence of Mother daughter ’s , Charles always attached Charles to Elizabeth ’s , for the pleasure of talking of Elizabeth ’s ; and when Charles was gone , Mother daughter ’s constantly sought the same means of relief . 
 
  “ Charles has made Mother daughter ’s so happy , ” said Mother daughter ’s , one evening , “ by telling Mother daughter ’s that Charles was totally ignorant of Mother daughter ’s being in town last spring ! Mother daughter ’s had not believed it possible . ” 
 
  “ Elizabeth ’s suspected as much , ” replied Elizabeth ’s . “ But how did Charles account for it ? ” 
 
  “ It must have been Charles sister ’s doing . They were certainly no friends to Charles acquaintance with Mother daughter ’s , which Elizabeth ’s can not wonder at , since Charles might have chosen so much more advantageously in many respects . But when they see , as Elizabeth ’s trust they will , that They brother is happy with Mother daughter ’s , they will learn to be contented , and their shall be on good terms again ; though their can never be what their once were to their . ” 
 
  “ That is the most unforgiving speech , ” said Elizabeth ’s , “ that Elizabeth ’s ever heard Mother daughter ’s utter . Good girl ! It would vex Elizabeth ’s , indeed , to see Mother daughter ’s again the dupe of Charles pretended regard . ” 
 
  “ Would Elizabeth ’s believe it , Elizabeth ’s , that when Charles went to town last November , Charles really loved Mother daughter ’s , and nothing but a persuasion of Mother daughter ’s being indifferent would have prevented Charles coming down again ! ” 
 
  “ Charles made a little mistake to be sure ; but it is to the credit of Charles modesty . ” 
 
  This naturally introduced a panegyric from Mother daughter ’s on Charles diffidence , and the little value Charles put on Charles own good qualities . Elizabeth ’s was pleased to find that Charles had not betrayed the interference of Charles friend ; for , though Mother daughter ’s had the most generous and forgiving heart in the world , Mother daughter ’s knew it was a circumstance which must prejudice Mother daughter ’s against Charles . 
 
  “ Mother daughter ’s am certainly the most fortunate creature that ever existed ! ” cried Mother daughter ’s . “ Oh ! Elizabeth ’s , why am Mother daughter ’s thus singled from Mother daughter ’s family , and blessed above Mother daughter ’s family ! If Mother daughter ’s could but see Elizabeth ’s as happy ! If there were but such another man for Elizabeth ’s ! ” 
 
  “ If Elizabeth ’s were to give Mother daughter ’s forty such men , Mother daughter ’s never could be so happy as Elizabeth ’s . Till Mother daughter ’s have Elizabeth ’s disposition , Elizabeth ’s goodness , Mother daughter ’s never can have Elizabeth ’s happiness . No , no , let Mother daughter ’s shift for Mother daughter ’s ; and , perhaps , if Mother daughter ’s have very good luck , Mother daughter ’s may meet with another William Collins in time . ” 
 
  The situation of affairs in the Longbourn family could not be long a secret . Mother was privileged to whisper The situation of affairs in the Longbourn family to Mrs. Phillips , and Mother ventured , without any permission , to do the same by all Mother neighbours in Meryton . 
 
  The Bennets were speedily pronounced to be the luckiest family in the world , though only a few weeks before , when Lydia had first run away , the Longbourn family had been generally proved to be marked out for misfortune . 
 Chapter 
 
  One morning , about a week after Charles ’s engagement with Jane had been formed , as Charles ’s and the females of the family were sitting together in the dining - room , Charles ’s and the females of the family attention was suddenly drawn to the window , by the sound of a carriage ; and Charles ’s and the females of the family perceived a chaise and four driving up the lawn . It was too early in the morning for visitors , and besides , the equipage did not answer to that of any of Charles ’s and the females of the family neighbours . The horses were post ; and neither a carriage , nor the livery of the servant who preceded a carriage , were familiar to Charles ’s and the females of the family . As it was certain , however , that Charles ’s and the females of the family visitor was coming , Charles ’s instantly prevailed on Miss Bennet to avoid the confinement of such an intrusion , and walk away with Charles ’s into the shrubbery . They both set off , and the conjectures of the females of the family continued , though with little satisfaction , till the door was thrown open and Charles ’s and the females of the family visitor entered . Charles ’s and the females of the family visitor was Cathleen . 
 
  Charles ’s and the females of the family were of course all intending to be surprised ; but Charles ’s and the females of the family astonishment was beyond Charles ’s and the females of the family expectation ; and on the part of Mother and Kitty , though Cathleen was perfectly unknown to Mother and Kitty , even inferior to what Elizabeth felt . 
 
  Cathleen entered the room with an air more than usually ungracious , made no other reply to Elizabeth ’s salutation than a slight inclination of the head , and sat down without saying a word . Elizabeth had mentioned Elizabeth name to Elizabeth mother on Charles ’s and the females of the family visitor entrance , though no request of introduction had been made . 
 
  Mother , all amazement , though flattered by having Cathleen , received Cathleen with the utmost politeness . After sitting for a moment in silence , Mother said very stiffly to Elizabeth , 
 
  “ Mother hope Elizabeth are well , Miss Bennet . Charles ’s and the females of the family visitor , Mother suppose , is Elizabeth mother . ” 
 
  Elizabeth replied very concisely that Charles ’s and the females of the family visitor was . 
 
  “ And that Elizabeth suppose is one of Mother sisters . ” 
 
  “ Yes , Elizabeth , ” said Mother , delighted to speak to Cathleen . “ Cathleen is Mother youngest girl but one . Mother youngest of all is lately married , and Mother eldest is somewhere about the grounds , walking with a young man who , Mother believe , will soon become a part of the family . ” 
 
  “ Mother have a very small park here , ” returned Cathleen after a short silence . 
 
  “ a very small park is nothing in comparison of Rosings , Cathleen lady , Cathleen dare say ; but Cathleen assure Mother a very small park is much larger than Sir William Lucas ’s . ” 
 
  “ This must be a most inconvenient sitting room for the evening , in summer ; the windows are full west . ” 
 
  Mother assured Elizabeth that they never sat there after dinner , and then added : 
 
  “ May Mother take the liberty of asking Elizabeth whether Elizabeth left Mr. and Mrs. Collins well . ” 
 
  “ Yes , very well . Elizabeth saw Mr. and Mrs. Collins the night before last . ” Elizabeth Elizabeth now expected that Mother would produce a letter for Elizabeth from Charlotte , as it seemed the only probable motive for Elizabeth calling . But no letter appeared , and Elizabeth was completely puzzled . 
 
  Mother , with great civility , begged Charles ’s and the females of the family visitor to take some refreshment ; but Cathleen very resolutely , and not very politely , declined eating anything ; and then , rising up , said to Elizabeth , 
 
  “ Miss Bennet , there seemed to be a prettyish kind of a little wilderness on one side of the lawn . Cathleen should be glad to take a turn in a prettyish kind of a little wilderness on one side of the lawn , if Elizabeth will favour Cathleen with Elizabeth company . ” 
 
  “ Go , Mother dear , ” cried Elizabeth mother , “ and show Elizabeth about the different walks . Mother think Elizabeth will be pleased with a prettyish kind of a little wilderness on one side of the lawn . ” 
 
  Elizabeth obeyed , and running into Elizabeth own room for Elizabeth parasol , attended Charles ’s and the females of the family visitor downstairs . As they passed through the hall , Cathleen opened the doors into the dining - parlour and drawing - room , and pronouncing the dining - parlour and drawing - room , after a short survey , to be decent looking rooms , walked on . 
 
  Cathleen carriage remained at the door , and Elizabeth saw that Elizabeth waiting - woman was in Cathleen carriage . They proceeded in silence along the gravel walk that led to the copse ; Elizabeth was determined to make no effort for conversation with Charles ’s and the females of the family visitor . 
 
  “ How could Elizabeth ever think Elizabeth like Charles ’s and the females of the family visitor nephew ? ” said Elizabeth , as Elizabeth looked in Elizabeth face . 
 
  As soon as they entered the copse , Cathleen began in the following manner : — 
 
  “ Elizabeth can be at no loss , Miss Bennet , to understand the reason of Cathleen journey hither . Elizabeth own heart , Elizabeth own conscience , must tell Miss Bennet why Cathleen come . ” 
 
  Elizabeth looked with unaffected astonishment . 
 
  “ Indeed , Cathleen are mistaken , Cathleen . Elizabeth have not been at all able to account for the honour of seeing Miss Bennet here . ” 
 
  “ Miss Bennet , ” replied Charles ’s and the females of the family visitor , in an angry tone , “ Miss Bennet ought to know , that Charles ’s and the females of the family visitor am not to be trifled with . But however insincere Miss Bennet may choose to be , Miss Bennet shall not find Charles ’s and the females of the family visitor so . Charles ’s and the females of the family visitor character has ever been celebrated for Charles ’s and the females of the family visitor character sincerity and frankness , and in a cause of such moment as this , Charles ’s and the females of the family visitor shall certainly not depart from Charles ’s and the females of the family visitor character . A report of a most alarming nature reached Charles ’s and the females of the family visitor two days ago . Charles ’s and the females of the family visitor was told that not only Cathleen was on the point of being most advantageously married , but that Elizabeth , that Miss Elizabeth , would , in all likelihood , be soon afterwards united to Charles ’s and the females of the family visitor nephew , Charles ’s and the females of the family visitor own nephew , Fitzwilliam . Though Charles ’s and the females of the family visitor know it must be a scandalous falsehood , though Charles ’s and the females of the family visitor would not injure Charles ’s and the females of the family visitor nephew , Charles ’s and the females of the family visitor own nephew , Fitzwilliam so much as to suppose the truth of it possible , Charles ’s and the females of the family visitor instantly resolved on setting off for this place , that Charles ’s and the females of the family visitor might make Charles ’s and the females of the family visitor sentiments known to Miss Bennet . ” 
 
  “ If Charles ’s and the females of the family visitor believed it impossible to be true , ” said Elizabeth , colouring with astonishment and disdain , “ Elizabeth wonder Charles ’s and the females of the family visitor took the trouble of coming so far . What could Charles ’s and the females of the family visitor ladyship propose by it ? ” 
 
  “ At once to insist upon having such a report universally contradicted . ” 
 
  “ Elizabeth coming to this place , to see Elizabeth and the family , ” said Elizabeth coolly , “ will be rather a confirmation of it ; if , indeed , such a report is in existence . ” 
 
  “ If ! Do you then pretend to be ignorant of such a report ? Has such a report not been industriously circulated by yourselves ? Do you not know that such a report is spread abroad ? ” 
 
  “ Elizabeth never heard that such a report was . ” 
 
  “ And can Elizabeth likewise declare , that there is no foundation for such a report ? ” 
 
  “ Elizabeth do not pretend to possess equal frankness with Charles ’s and the females of the family visitor . Miss Bennet may ask questions which Elizabeth shall not choose to answer . ” 
 
  “ This is not to be borne . Miss Bennet , Charles ’s and the females of the family visitor insist on being satisfied . Has Charles ’s and the females of the family visitor nephew , Charles ’s and the females of the family visitor own nephew , Fitzwilliam , has Charles ’s and the females of the family visitor nephew , Charles ’s and the females of the family visitor own nephew , Fitzwilliam , made Miss Bennet an offer of marriage ? ” 
 
  “ Charles ’s and the females of the family visitor has declared an offer of marriage to be impossible . ” 
 
  “ an offer of marriage ought to be so ; an offer of marriage must be so , while Charles ’s and the females of the family visitor nephew , Charles ’s and the females of the family visitor own nephew , Fitzwilliam retains the use of Charles ’s and the females of the family visitor nephew , Charles ’s and the females of the family visitor own nephew , Fitzwilliam reason . But Miss Bennet arts and allurements may , in a moment of infatuation , have made Charles ’s and the females of the family visitor nephew , Charles ’s and the females of the family visitor own nephew , Fitzwilliam forget what Charles ’s and the females of the family visitor nephew , Charles ’s and the females of the family visitor own nephew , Fitzwilliam owes to Charles ’s and the females of the family visitor nephew , Charles ’s and the females of the family visitor own nephew , Fitzwilliam and to all Charles ’s and the females of the family visitor nephew , Charles ’s and the females of the family visitor own nephew , Fitzwilliam family . Miss Bennet may have drawn Charles ’s and the females of the family visitor nephew , Charles ’s and the females of the family visitor own nephew , Fitzwilliam in . ” 
 
  “ If Miss Bennet have , Miss Bennet shall be the last person to confess it . ” 
 
  “ Miss Bennet , do Miss Bennet know who Cathleen am ? Cathleen have not been accustomed to such language as this . Cathleen am almost the nearest relation Charles ’s and the females of the family visitor nephew , Charles ’s and the females of the family visitor own nephew , Fitzwilliam has in the world , and am entitled to know all Charles ’s and the females of the family visitor nephew , Charles ’s and the females of the family visitor own nephew , Fitzwilliam dearest concerns . ” 
 
  “ But Elizabeth are not entitled to know Miss Bennet ; nor will such behaviour as this , ever induce Cathleen to be explicit . ” 
 
  “ Let Charles ’s and the females of the family visitor be rightly understood . This match , to which Elizabeth have the presumption to aspire , can never take place . No , never .   The discomposure of spirits which this extraordinary visit threw Elizabeth into , could not be easily overcome ; nor could Elizabeth , for many hours , learn to think of this extraordinary visit less than incessantly . Cathleen , it appeared , had actually taken the trouble of this journey from Rosings , for the sole purpose of breaking off Cathleen supposed engagement with Fitzwilliam . It was a rational scheme , to be sure ! but from what the report of their engagement could originate , Elizabeth was at a loss to imagine ; till Elizabeth recollected that Fitzwilliam being the intimate friend of Charles , and Cathleen being the sister of Jane , was enough , at a time when the expectation of one wedding made everybody eager for another , to supply the idea .  Chapter 
 
  Instead of receiving any such letter of excuse from Charles friend , as Elizabeth half expected Charles to do , Charles was able to bring Fitzwilliam with Charles to Longbourn before many days had passed after Cathleen ’s visit . Very little was said by either ; Kitty was too much afraid of Kitty to talk ; Elizabeth was secretly forming a desperate resolution ; and perhaps Fitzwilliam might be doing the same . 
 
  They walked towards the Lucases , because Kitty wished to call upon Maria ; and as Elizabeth saw no occasion for making it a general concern , when Kitty left They Elizabeth went boldly on with Kitty alone . Now was the moment for Elizabeth resolution to be executed , and , while Elizabeth courage was high , Elizabeth immediately said :

  Elizabeth , feeling all the more than common awkwardness and anxiety of Fitzwilliam situation , now forced Elizabeth to speak ; and immediately , though not very fluently , gave Fitzwilliam to understand that Elizabeth sentiments had undergone so material a change , since the period to which Fitzwilliam alluded , as to make Elizabeth receive with gratitude and pleasure Fitzwilliam present assurances . The happiness which this reply produced , was such as Fitzwilliam had probably never felt before ; and Fitzwilliam expressed Fitzwilliam on the occasion as sensibly and as warmly as a man violently in love can be supposed to do .
